scripts.say: Southern coast of Greenland, near Cape Farewell
The silhouette of a little girl formed beneath the waves. She was sneakily swimming her way forwards, heading for a white leaf which had suddenly poked out from under the water.
Foooound yooou!
Grabbing hold of it like a gardener would a weed, the girl uprooted the strange leaf-shaped object.
*Gasp*!
I'm 10-and-0 now! Time to admit your defeat!
Unfaaaaiiir. My dorsal fin sticks out.
... That's just your hair, not a dorsal fin. And weren't you the one who suggested playing hide-and-seek in the first place?
The real game begins noooow. Raaaawr.
... You said that when I won for the 5th time!
Doesn't count because I didn't say raaaawr then.
Well, I wouldn't mind playing a little more, so... Wait, this is no time for games! We have a mission to do!
Actually, today I'm in the mood for a picnic.
Lord Bismarck entrusted us with this important mission! Who cares what you're in the mood for!
I repeat: "Prized wolfpacks of the Iron Blood, you must not let a single enemy transport vessel pass through!"
If a pack of wolves went into the ocean, they'd all droooown.
But U-110 is a shark, so those orders don't applyyyyy. Lookie look.
The Iron Blood submarine proudly swung her dorsal fin-like hairstyle from side to side.
L-look, we're not literal wolves, we're called a "wolfpack" as a metaphor! Lord Bismarck's orders were... Hey! Stop looking at me like I don't make any sense!
*Sigh*... I'm too tired to try to explain it to you...
Anyway, let's go carry out our mission! An enemy's appeared somewhere nearby!
Alrightyyyy. U-110, sharky shark, ready to embaaaark.
